Package org.jconfigurations.configurators

Contains the Configurator interface and all its implementations.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Configurator
    A Configurator assigns values to fields annotated with Configuration of any arbritrary object.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BaseConfigurator
    Handy abstract class that does the heavy-lifting for BaseConfigurator.configure(java.lang.Object).
    BasicConfigurator
    The BasicConfigurator will target all Configuration fields of an object.
    CollectionConfigurator
    The CollectionConfigurator will target all CollectionConfiguration fields of an object.
    JConfigurator
    A handy Configurator provided for the user's convenience to minimize refactoring on the calling code by having to manually add another Configurator to their chain as new features become available.
    MapConfigurator
    The MapConfigurator will target all @MapConfiguration fields of an object.
    NoOpConfigurator
    Special kind of Configurator that does absolutely nothing when its NoOpConfigurator.configure(java.lang.Object) method is invoked.
    RequiredConfigurator
    A Configurator with the sole responsibility of making sure that a required field's configuration is present in the ConfigurationSource.

Package org.jconfigurations.configurators Description

 Contains the Configurator interface and all its implementations.
 
 Each Configurator is developed together with its respective annotation that can be found in the 
 org.jconfigurations package. Eg. Configuration was introduced together with BasicConfigurator, meaning 
 that BasicConfigurator is the only Configurator provided by the framework that will be triggered on fields marked 
 with Configuration.
 
 Configurators provided by the framework can be chained together to combine features that act on 
 combinations of annotations. The special NoOpConfigurator is used to end these chains.
